author: ratz
title: so what's the idea?
review:
ideas book #250 differs a bit from #200, although it was published only 2 years later: the models are bigger and patially electrified. you get suggestions to employ your 4.5v electrical supplements, and wonderful medieval and classic space settings are presented!
if you plan to get it, watch out the sticker sheet is included, again providing you (only) with town-related adhesives.

author: desser1
title: Creativity Booster
review:
This book was great and helped me a lot as a little boy seeing that there's more to every Lego set then only the main model. I tried many of the models shown there or using as a starting point for own designs. The models given cover almost the whole Lego range back then (except Duplo, Fabuland and Technic) with nice basic models, a lot of town ideas (with a nice sticker set in the middle) and very nice space and castle theme sugestions. the last two of those were quiet frustrating, because they also showed some fantastic, very large models I knew, I would never be able to built. The last page shows ideas for motorised models.
This books gives hours of nice building experience for little money and provides nice stickers (for town models only).

author: LEGOCityManiac11
title: Good Idea Book
review: This book is really nice and has some really neat models, but I at first did not have enough pieces.  It used to be my mom's which she used as a tutor for her students to play with.  Now I can build most of the things in there.
